member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.RumbleWaveForms
member.summary: Waveforms that are available for rumble devices

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights
member.summary: The height of a device relative to the user's head - see \ref page_locs_and_heights.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX_ThreadType
member.summary: The thread types available for use by amBX. Currently, there's only one type.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX_RESULT
member.summary:
This is the type returned from almost all amBX calls - amBX_OK means the call was successful, any other result is an error.
Generally speaking, User Code won't have to deal with these error codes as matching exceptions are generated when one of these error codes are detected.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX_EnabledStates
member.summary: The state of a particular amBX object. Objects can be enabled, disabled or in the process of being enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor.R
member.summary: The floating point Red value (between 0 and 1).

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor.B
member.summary: The floating point Blue value (between 0 and 1).

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor.G
member.summary: The floating point Green value (between 0 and 1).

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Construct a new amBX Color object.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor.toColor
member.summary: Convert an amBXColor into a normal Color object.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXColor
member.summary: Floating point color structure. Simplifies working with amBX style floating point color values.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.#ctor
member.summary: Class is not publicly creatable

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.amBXCreateInterface(System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The function exported from the amBX runtime dll to initiate all communication with the amBX drivers. The amBXrt.dll file is included with the amBX SDK.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.IamBX
member.summary: This structure wraps the IamBX interface and its pointer so it can be readily used when calling into the low level amBX interface function pointers.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.IamBXInterface
member.summary: This structure matches the layout of the C amBX class as an array of function pointers (the order is significant and must match!)

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.IamBXDelegates
member.summary: Holds Delegates to all the functions pointed to by the pointers in IamBXInterface. This makes them easy to call via .net.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Connect(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called when you want to open a channel of communication to the amBX drivers. Calling it more than once will have no effect. Call DISCONNECT to shut down the connection
member.param: The Major version of the required amBX library.
The Minor version of the required amBX library.
The name of your application.
The version of your application.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.IsConnected
member.summary: Returns whether we've successfully connected to the amBX drivers

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.CheckConnected
member.summary: Verify that we have a valid amBX connection before attempting any operations.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.UpdateThreadRun
member.summary: Private routine run on a worker thread to constantly update amBX

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.UpdatesPerSecond
member.summary: How many times per second should the library update amBX?

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect from the amBX drivers and release all created objects and buffers.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable all devices currently associated with amBX.
member.value: A boolean, true to enable all devices, false to disable them.
member.returns: A boolean indicating where all devices are enabled or disabled.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Update(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Checks all device interfaces for updates and sends updated attributes to the amBX engine, if required.
Under normal circumstances, this library will automatically call Update via a background worker thread, so there should be no need for your application to call this method explicitly.
member.param: Under normal configuration, this code handles threading and updates so this parameter will be ignored.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.GetVersionInfo(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the version of the amBX drivers that are installed
member.param: The Major version of the installed amBX driver.
The Minor version of the installed amBX driver.
The revision number of the installed amBX driver.
The build number of the installed amBX driver.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.RunThread(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX_ThreadType,System.Int32)
member.summary: The entry point for a thread used by amBX to send updates from the device interfaces to the amBX engine. This should be called inside your thread, and it will not exit until you call stopThread() with the thread ID from outside the thread. See page_threading for more details.
member.param: An indicator of how the thread being run should be used. Currently the only valid value is \b amBX_Ambient_Update.

An identifier for the thread being run. This value is used to identify the thread ready for 'stopThread'. This value must be unique otherwise the functionality of stopThread is undetermined. Typically the operating system thread ID is used.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.StopThread(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to stop the execution of a thread started with runThread(). After the successful call of stopThread(), runThread() - which was called inside the thread - will return. See page_threading.
member.param: An identifier for the thread being stopped. This value should be the same as the ID passed to runThread().

member.summary: Retrieve the collection of all Lights objects

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.LightCollection
member.summary: The Collection of light objects that have been created.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.#ctor(System.String,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Constructor for a new Light object. You must indicate where the light is located at this point. The location of the object cannot be changed.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.#ctor(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Constructor for a new Light object. You must indicate where the light is located at this point. The location of the object cannot be changed.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.Name
member.summary: Name of this Light

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.Color
member.summary: Set the target color (represented by a normal .net COLOR object) of the light device interface, towards which the actual color of the light should change at the fade rate set by FadeTime().
member.value: A Color representing a Red Green Blue value for the light. The Alpha channel is ignored.
member.returns: A Color representing a Red Green Blue value of the light. The Alpha channel is left as 0.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.amBXColor
member.summary: Set the target color (represented by an amBXColor floating point color object) of the light device interface, towards which the actual color of the light should change at the fade rate set by FadeTime().
member.value: An amBXColor representing a Red Green Blue value for the light.
member.returns: An amBXColor representing a Red Green Blue value of the light.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.FadeTime
member.summary: Sets the time taken to transition to the target color when the color is changed.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.Location
member.summary: Retrieve the target location of light effect. This can be multiple locations OR'd together.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.Enabled
member.summary: Retrieve the Enabled state of this light object.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.LightUpdateIntervalMS
member.summary: updates in this light interface will not be sent to the amBX engine before a time of LightUpdateIntervalMS has passed since the previous update of this interface that has been sent to the engine. Default value is 100ms.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light.LightDelta
member.summary: Minimum required change per color component that triggers sending an update. 0.0f <= fLightDelta <= 1.0f Default value is .02.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Light
member.summary: This object represents a Light object in amBX "space". When you create it, you must indicate "where" the light is located. The location cannot change once it's created.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.FanCollection
member.summary: The Collection of fan objects that have been created.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.#ctor(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Constructor for the Fan class.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.#ctor(System.String,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Constructor for the Fan class.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Initialize(System.String,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Constructor for the Fan class.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Name
member.summary: Name of this Fan

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Intensity
member.summary: Set or retrieve the intensity level of the fan effect.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Location
member.summary: Retrieve the location of this Fan effect. Note that the location is set when the object is created and can't be changed.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Enabled
member.summary: Retrieve the enabled state of this fan object. States are: ENABLED if the fan is enabled ENABLING if the fan is currently not enabled, but will be enabled after the next time the amBX.Update function is called. DISABLED if the fan is disabled DISABLING if the fan is currently enabled, but will disabled after the next time the amBX.Update function is called.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Enable
member.summary: Enable this fan object

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.Disable
member.summary: Disable this fan object

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.FanUpdateIntervalMS
member.summary: updates on this fan will not be sent to the amBX engine before a time of FanUpdateIntervalMS has passed since the previous update of this interface that has been sent to the engine. Default value is 100ms

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan.FanDelta
member.summary: Minimum required change per color component that triggers sending an update. 0.0f <= fLightDelta <= 1.0f Default value is .02

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Fan
member.summary: This class represents the fan device interface - enabling the creation of air flow (wind) experiences.

member.summary: Constructor for a new Rumble object. The location and Height are declared at creation time and cannot be changed.

member.summary: Constructor for a new Rumble object. The location and Height are declared at creation time and cannot be changed.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Initialize(System.String,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Actually create the rumble object

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.ReInitialize(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Locations,amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Heights)
member.summary: Provides a way to reinitialize the underlying object so we can disable it.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Name
member.summary: Name of this Rumble

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Height
member.summary: Retrieves the height of the rumble object as it was set during object creation.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Release
member.summary: Release the internal ambx interface for this object This is normally automatically performed when the object is disposed of or when the ambx object is released.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.SetRumble(System.String,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the Rumble Waveform, speed and intensity for this rumble object.
member.param: The string name of the rumble waveform.
The speed of playback, from 0.0 to 10.0
The intensity of the rumble effect, from 0.0 to 1.0

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.SetRumble(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.RumbleWaveForms,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the Rumble Waveform, speed and intensity for this rumble object.
member.param: The ID of the rumble waveform.
The speed of playback, from 0.0 to 10.0
The intensity of the rumble effect, from 0.0 to 1.0

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.GetRumble(System.String@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Retrieve the rumble waveform, speed and intensity as currently set for this rumble object.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.GetRumble(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.RumbleWaveForms@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Retrieve the rumble waveform, speed and intensity as currently set for this rumble object.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Location
member.summary: Retrieve the location of this rumble object (set when the object was created). Note that this could be a combination of location values.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Enabled
member.summary: Retrieve the Enabled state of this object. States can be: ENABLED if the rumble is enabled ENABLING if the rumble is currently not enabled, but will be enabled after the next time the IamBX.Update() is called. DISABLED if the rumble is not disabled DISABLING if the rumble is currently enabled, but will be disabled after the next time the IamBX.Update() is called.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Enable
member.summary: Enable this rumble object.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.Disable
member.summary: Disable this rumble object.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.RumbleUpdateIntervalMS
member.summary: updates in this rumble interface will not be sent to the amBX engine before a time of RumbleUpdateIntervalMS has passed since the previous update of this interface that has been sent to the engine. Default value is 100ms

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.SpeedDelta
member.summary: Minimum required change of the speed component that triggers sending an update. 0.0f <= SpeedDelta <= 1.0f Default value is .02

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble.IntensityDelta
member.summary: Minimum required change Intensity component that triggers sending an update. 0.0f <= IntensityDelta <= 1.0f Default value is .02

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Rumble
member.summary: This class represents an amBX Rumble object, enabling the creation of rumble experiences.

member.summary: Create a new Event object based on the contents of a buffer.
member.param: A byte array containing the event data, preferably read from a bn/ck file. Note, the buffer must contain valid data and cannot be nothing or empty.

member.summary: Create a new Event object based on the contents of a bn/ck file.

member.summary: Create a new Event object based on the contents of a buffer.
member.param: A byte array containing the event data, preferably read from a bn/ck file. Note, the buffer must contain valid data and cannot be nothing or empty.

member.summary: Create a new Event object based on the contents of a bn/ck file.

member.summary: Name of this Event

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Event.Play
member.summary: Plays the amBX file loaded when the interface was created.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Event.Stop
member.summary: Stops the playback of the event.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Event
member.summary: Create an Event, which is usually a short sequence of effects that cannot be paused or seeked into, or an ambience effect which can be simply turned on or off.

member.summary: The Collection of Event objects that have been created.

member.summary: Create a new Movie object based on the contents of a buffer.
member.param: A byte array containing the event data, preferably read from a bn/ck file.

member.summary: Create a new Movie object based on the contents of a bn/ck file.

member.summary: Initialize the internal elements and create the Movie interface

member.summary: Name of this Movie

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Play
member.summary: Method to simplify playing a loaded movie. Basically, just Seek to the beginning and unsuspend.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Pause
member.summary: Pause this movie's playback

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Continue
member.summary: Continue a paused movie

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Stop
member.summary: Stop playback and reset the movie to the beginning.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Frozen
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the frozen state of this movie.

member.name: P:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Suspended
member.summary: Sets or retrieves the suspended state of this move.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie.Seek(System.Single)
member.summary: Jumps to the specified point in time within the movie. The seek will on be made if the absolute difference of the current time and the last seek time is greater than the seek threshold (Currently 0.2 seconds).

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX.Movie
member.summary: Represents an amBX Movie object, which is a sequence of effects that can be paused or seeked into, and restarted arbitrarily. Mainly used for cutscenes. You should only create movie objects as you need them, and release them when done.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX
member.summary: Core ambx Class. This class is static and cannot be instantiated. It represents the core amBX device and as such, there can only ever be one to a machine.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Exceptions.#ctor
member.summary: Eases exception handling and generation, Internal only, not a creatable class.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Exceptions.Check(amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBX_RESULT,System.String)
member.summary: Check an amBX error code and throw the applicable exception

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.amBXException
member.summary: The Generic amBX exception. All the specific exceptions inherit from this one.

member.name: M:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Utility.ConstrainFloat(System.Single@)
member.summary: Simple routine to contrains a single between 0 and 1.

member.name: T:amBXTest.amBXLibrary.Utility
member.summary: Various routines for use internally by the amBX library classes.

member.name: P:amBXTest.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:amBXTest.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:amBXTest.My.Resources.Resources
